titles.title: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014
Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014
To authorize the Administrator of General Services to convey a parcel of real property in Albuquerque, New Mexico, to the Amy Biehl High School Foundation.
Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure. H. Rept. 113-408.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 300.

action.text: Mr. Young (AK) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3998.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management
committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the House on April 9, 2014. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014 - Directs the Administrator of General Services (GSA) to offer to convey to the Amy Biehl High School Foundation certain federal lands, including any improvements on such lands, located in Albuquerque, New Mexico.
Requires such conveyance to be in accordance with a fair market value appraisal that is acceptable to the Administrator.
Makes the Foundation responsible for the costs related to such conveyance.
Requires the proceeds from such conveyance to be paid into the Federal Buildings Fund.
Requires the conveyance to occur within three years of this Act's enactment.
